p: The dunes of Quiaios (SD1 and SD2, Figure 2 ) are a coastal strain of primary and secondary sand dunes with associated pine forests that extends inland. These sites are characterized by a mosaic of several well-established plant communities, including native perennial herbs (e.g., Ammophila arenaria and Corynephorus canescens) alternating with chamaephytic shrublands (e.g., Corema album, Cistus salviifolius, Artemisia campestris). Between the different plants assemblages there are large areas dominated by invasive plant species (e.g., Carpobrotus edulis, Arundo donax, Acacia saligna, and A. longifolia).
